column4: I'm getting a strange error when my client tries to connect to the network.  It says: "dh-client-script permission denied"
my other thought is a script that isn't set to executable. :/
if I "ls -ltr" the file, it shows up as red .. this mean anything to you?
yeah, background read means executes as root from any user.
when I chgrp'ed it, the red went away :P I don't know how to set it back, heh
you would have been better off to change the user numbers to match the appropriate file.  group?
the problem is I forgot to back up my "group" file.  I'm predicting that I have to reinstall to get the old file back
here's my interpretation.  My master computer has an old operating system (Gutsy) while the client machine has Hardy
is that closer to the truth?
exactly.  I don't know an easy solution.  My concern is that many other files may suffer the same fate.
that's exactly what I'm worried about.  I may have to reinstall because I don't know how the numbers got changed ...
